title: 105_hr2985
content: Aliens are ineligible for visas and excluded from admission for nonpayment of child support. Aliens can be deemed inadmissible for failing to pay child support as legally required under a judgment, decree, or order. Aliens can be deemed inadmissible for failure to pay child support exceeding $5,000 until payments are satisfied or a payment agreement is approved. The amendment applies to visas issued 180 days after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 2. REMOVAL OF ALIENS FOR NONPAYMENT OF CHILD SUPPORT. Section 237(a) of the Immigration and Nationality Act is amended to include deporting any alien who fails to pay child support exceeding $5,000 as legally obligated. The amendment requires aliens to satisfy payments under a judgment or be in compliance with a payment agreement. The effective date of this amendment is 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Aliens must pay child support to be eligible for naturalization. Aliens seeking naturalization must fulfill child support obligations to be eligible, as stated in the amended Section 318 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. This amendment applies to naturalization applications filed 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Authorization to serve legal process in child support cases on certain arriving aliens. Immigration officers are authorized to serve legal process in child support cases on arriving aliens applying for admission to the United States, in accordance with State law. The legal process for enforcing child support obligations includes writs, orders, or summons issued by a court or administrative agency in any State, territory, or possession of the United States. The amendment allows authorized officials to access information for aliens applying for admission to the United States. It will apply to applicants 180 days after the enactment of the Act. The amendment authorizes the Immigration and Naturalization Service to request information on delinquent child support payments from the Secretary, aiding in determining if an alien is behind on child support.
